original: de'i tshe yang mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs pa la yang de mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs pa la yang de mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, the realization would be impermanent, following the impermanence of the seeing.

original: de lta yin na 'bras bu ni 'bras bu gzhan sngon du 'gro ba ca kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta yin na 'bras bu ni 'bras bu gzhan sngon du 'gro ba ca kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If that were so, then the effect would be seen only as preceded by another effect.ğŸ”½The meaning is that the effect is understood to have a cause that is a specific instance of something seen, and not a cause that is a permanent, specific instance that is not seen at all.

original: gnag gi phyir 'bras bu ni mthong ba'i bye brag gi bye brag can kho na rgyu yin par rtogs par byed kyi shin tu ma mthong ba'i rtag pa nyid kyi bye brag can yin no zhes dgongs pas rgyu med pa'i rgyu ni ma dmigs so zhes pas rnamğŸ”½par 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: gnag gi phyir 'bras bu ni mthong ba'i bye brag gi bye brag can kho na rgyu yin par rtogs par byed kyi shin tu ma mthong ba'i rtag pa nyid kyi bye brag can yin no zhes dgongs pas rgyu med pa'i rgyu ni ma dmigs so zhes pas rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
translated: The commentary explains that the cause of the effect is not non-apprehended, because the cause is not intended to be permanent.

original: dbye ba rnams kyi 'gro ba mthong ba las rgyur rtogs pa na rjes su dran pa gzhan yod na mi rtag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam //
analyzed: dbye ba rnams kyi 'gro ba mthong ba las rgyur rtogs pa na rjes su dran pa gzhan yod na mi rtag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam //
translated: If the cause is understood to be the cause of the seen movement of the parts, would it not be impermanent, since it is different from the memory?

original: med na mi rtag pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: med na mi rtag pa kho na yin te /
translated: If it were not, it would be impermanent.

original: rgyur rtogs pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rgyur rtogs pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Because there is no valid cognition of the cause.ğŸ”½If the cause is understood to be the cause of the seen movement of the parts, would it not be impermanent, since it is different from the memory?

original: 'on te tha dad pa rnams rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa rnams rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, is it because they are the same in being the subsequent state of that which is different?

original: dbye ba rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba ni mo nges pa yin pas rgyu'i go byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbye ba rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba ni mo nges pa yin pas rgyu'i go byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The subsequent state of the divisions is not seen, and that is the reason why it is not the cause.

original: de lta mod @145a * //
analyzed: de lta mod @145a * //
translated: But that is not so.

original: kyi 'bras bu ni yin no //
analyzed: kyi 'bras bu ni yin no //
translated: It is the effect.

original: de yang mthong ba'i bye brag kho na yin gyi ma mthong ba'i bye brag ni ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de yang mthong ba'i bye brag kho na yin gyi ma mthong ba'i bye brag ni ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: And that is only the seen difference, not the unseen difference.

original: snying stobs la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the reply: â€œsattva, etc.â€

original: de lta yin na bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang / sems pa can rnams la dngos po nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba las /
analyzed: de lta yin na bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang / sems pa can rnams la dngos po nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba las /
translated: If that is so, then pleasure, etc., and the sentient beings are the same in being the subsequent state of the thing itself.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo gcig yin la /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo gcig yin la /

original: de nyid ni gtso bo yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni gtso bo yin no snyam du sems pa ni /

analyzed: yang na rgyu gzhan gcig nyid ces bya ba'o //

analyzed: de lta yin na yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi gtso bo sgrub bo sgrub pa la dbye ba rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ni de las bzlog pa'i dngos po nyid tsam gyi bdag nyid bsgrub pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa la gnod par byed

original: pa'i 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: pa'i 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /

original: yon tan gsum rdzogs rang bzhin du //
analyzed: yon tan gsum rdzogs rang bzhin du //

original: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i khyad par dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i khyad par dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a motivator and because it is contradictory to a particular that is desired.

original: de nyid kyis ma nges pa yin pas khyad par dang 'gal ba'i phyir khyad par 'phangs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ma nges pa yin pas khyad par dang 'gal ba'i phyir khyad par 'phangs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is just that which is uncertain, it is contradictory to a particular. The meaning is that it is not projected as a particular.

original: de la yang khyad par du bsgrub par bya ba la rang nyid mi nus pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de la yang khyad par du bsgrub par bya ba la rang nyid mi nus pa nyid yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the person himself is not capable of establishing the specific property,

original: dbyibs dang ldan pa nyid khyad par can sgrub par byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs dang ldan pa nyid khyad par can sgrub par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: then the specific property, being endowed with shape, is the only thing that is established.

original: snyam du sems pa ni /ğŸ”½'on te 'di ni rang nyid nus pa yin //
analyzed: snyam du sems pa ni / 'on te 'di ni rang nyid nus pa yin //
translated: If you think this,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is as follows:ğŸ”½If the person himself is capable,ğŸ”½then the specific property is not established.

original: khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa'am /
translated: The uncommon reason that has a specific property,

original: ma grub pa yang yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: or the nonestablished, is taught as follows:

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The potter, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni las brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni las brjod pa yin la /
translated: The word â€œetc.â€ refers to the action.

original: las yod pa yin na nus pa nus pa can gyi rgyu med pa nyid du ma grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: las yod pa yin na nus pa nus pa can gyi rgyu med pa nyid du ma grub pa yin gyi /
translated: If the action exists, then the capacity is not established as causeless.

original: dper na rdza mkhan yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na rdza mkhan yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, the potter exists. This is the meaning.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis rdza mkhan dang las la nus pa mthong bas bsgrub bya don gzhan la gzhan grub pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis rdza mkhan dang las la nus pa mthong bas bsgrub bya don gzhan la gzhan grub pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since the potter and the action are seen to have capacity by means of direct perception and inference, the establishment of the object of the probandum is established by another. This is taught as follows:

original: dbang phyug la yang dbang phyug dam par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la yang dbang phyug dam par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and also the Lord is called the Supreme Lord.

original: yang na thug pa med pa yin na rtsa ba ma grub pas bsgrub bya la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang na thug pa med pa yin na rtsa ba ma grub pas bsgrub bya la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin la /
translated: If there is an infinite regress, then since the root is not established, there is no pervasion of the probandum, and so it is uncertain.

original: de bzhin du phan tshun rten pa yang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du phan tshun rten pa yang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Similarly, it is also the case that there is mutual dependence.

original: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la ji ltar yang dbyibs su 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la ji ltar yang dbyibs su 'dod pa yin /
translated: But if the probandum is the property of the subject, then how can it be shape?

original: de la bye brag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bye brag med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no difference in that.

original: rdul phra rab rnams la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: And because it would also apply to atoms.

original: ldog pa ma grub pa dang the tshom za ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ldog pa ma grub pa dang the tshom za ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The nonestablishment and doubt of the reverse pervasion are taught by

original: rdul phran dag la dbyibs med ces //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdul phran dag la dbyibs med ces // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œAtoms do not have shape.â€

original: re zhig dngos po rnams ni mtha' yas pas 'jig pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po rnams ni mtha' yas pas 'jig pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: First, since things are infinite, they are not nonexistent.

original: ri rab bzhin du cha tsam yang mi dpogs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ri rab bzhin du cha tsam yang mi dpogs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it would be impossible to measure even a portion of them, like Mount Meru,

original: mthar dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthar dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: they are not ultimately nonexistent.

original: med pa las dngos po skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa las dngos po skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that things arise from what does not exist.ğŸ”½Therefore, the idea that the atom is partless

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab ni cha shas med pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab ni cha shas med pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: is untenable.

original: rags pa gang yin pa de ni //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rags pa gang yin pa de ni // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Whatever is gross is not partless.ğŸ”½Whatever is gross is not partless.

original: rdul phra rab gnyis pa'i pha rol @148b ni cha shas dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab gnyis pa'i pha rol @148b ni cha shas dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: The other side of the atom is not partless,

original: mtha' yas pa nyid kyis dpag tu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa nyid kyis dpag tu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it is infinite, since it is limitless.

original: snang ba las phyi ma'i ngo bo ni tshad mas rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba las phyi ma'i ngo bo ni tshad mas rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The fact that the nature of what is beyond the atom is not established by a valid cognition is taught by the following:

original: rdul brgyad pa las pha rol gyi //
analyzed: rdul brgyad pa las pha rol gyi //
translated: The other side of the eightfold atom

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is not established by a valid cognition.

original: mtha' med pa de bsgrub pa la rdul phran brgyad pa kho nas tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: mtha' med pa de bsgrub pa la rdul phran brgyad pa kho nas tshad ma yin te /
translated: In order to establish that it is limitless, the eightfold atom is the valid cognition.ğŸ”½If it did not exist, then its nature would not exist.

original: de med na 'di'i ngo bo nyid kho na med par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dgongs pas /
analyzed: de med na 'di'i ngo bo nyid kho na med par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dgongs pas /
translated: With this in mind, it says:

original: 'di rdul brgyad pa'i rang bzhin nam //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rdul brgyad pa'i rang bzhin nam //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the nature of the eightfold atom.

original: snang ba'i dngos po ni rags pa nyid kho na yin pa las rdul phran gyi go bar byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: snang ba'i dngos po ni rags pa nyid kho na yin pa las rdul phran gyi go bar byed pa yin nam /
translated: But the coarse is just the appearance of things.ğŸ”½What is the point of analyzing them in terms of atoms?

original: grangs kyi dbye bas so sor snang bas ci zhig bya snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: grangs kyi dbye bas so sor snang bas ci zhig bya snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: But if you think that the coarse is just the appearance of things,ğŸ”½then the verse says,

original: 'on te shin tu de rags des //
analyzed: 'on te shin tu de rags des //
translated: But if the coarse is just the appearance of things,ğŸ”½then the coarse would not exist for those who have not seen the object.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by the verse,ğŸ”½But if the coarse is just the appearance of things,ğŸ”½then the coarse would not exist for those who have not seen the object.

original: kha cig la ltos nas kha cig rags pa yin pa 'di la ni snang ba las gzhan pa ma mthong ba la ltos bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig la ltos nas kha cig rags pa yin pa 'di la ni snang ba las gzhan pa ma mthong ba la ltos bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you think that something is coarse in relation to something else,

original: de ma grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ma grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: then the verse says,

original: gang tshe rdul gnyis can sogs pa //
analyzed: gang tshe rdul gnyis can sogs pa //
translated: But if something is coarse in relation to something else,ğŸ”½then the coarse would not exist for those who have not seen the object.ğŸ”½But if you think that the coarse is just the appearance of things,

original: zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½dngos po rnams mtha' yas pas /ğŸ”½'jig pa med par mi dpogs pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // dngos po rnams mtha' yas pas / 'jig pa med par mi dpogs pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: then the verse says,ğŸ”½But if the coarse is just the appearance of things,

original: mthar dngos po med pa la yang dbye ba med na dbye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½gang mthar 'jig pa de rdul phra rab du dpog par byed pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: mthar dngos po med pa la yang dbye ba med na dbye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir / gang mthar 'jig pa de rdul phra rab du dpog par byed pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: then the coarse would not exist for those who have not seen the object.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ltos na //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ltos na //
translated: But if you think that something is coarse in relation to something else,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the verse says,ğŸ”½But if something is coarse in relation to something else,ğŸ”½then the coarse would not exist for those who have not seen the object.

original: rjes su dpog bzhin pa yang de ji ltar mthong ba kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpog bzhin pa yang de ji ltar mthong ba kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and what is being inferred is just what is seen.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Nor is it dissimilar,

original: dpag tu med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it immeasurable,

original: cha shas med kyang blo la sogs pa 'jig par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: cha shas med kyang blo la sogs pa 'jig par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: because even though it is partless, one sees the destruction of the mind and so on.

original: dbye ba nyid kyis 'jig par nges pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dbye ba nyid kyis 'jig par nges pa ma yin la /
translated: Nor is it certain that it is destroyed by division itself,

original: rgyu ni snang ba gzhan gyi snang ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ni snang ba gzhan gyi snang ba kho na yin no //
translated: and the cause is just the appearance of another appearance.

original: spro ba la sogs pa la mi snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: spro ba la sogs pa la mi snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does not appear in emanations and so on,

original: ma yin te 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzhan gyi snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzhan gyi snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because it is the appearance of another world system.

original: de nyid la tshad ma gang yin spros pha la yang gang yin zhes mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid la tshad ma gang yin spros pha la yang gang yin zhes mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni / thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: The question, â€œWhat is the valid knowledge with respect to that? What is it with respect to emanations?â€ is the same, as is taught:

original: zhes bya ba ste /ğŸ”½snang ba'i dngos las gzhan pa la ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / snang ba'i dngos las gzhan pa la ni /
translated: There would be the fallacy of infinite regress.

original: mngon sum ma yin zhing rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin zhing rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is neither direct perception nor inference with respect to anything other than the entity that appears.

original: bong ba ni dgos pa na phyis shing phyis shing je chung 'gro ba ma yin @149a * //
analyzed: bong ba ni dgos pa na phyis shing phyis shing je chung 'gro ba ma yin @149a * //
translated: A clod of earth, when needed, is not reduced in size by being used again and again.

original: nam ; gang la chung ngur 'gyur du mi btub pa'i mchog tu phra ba de la rdul phra rab ces bdag cag rnams zer ro //
analyzed: nam ; gang la chung ngur 'gyur du mi btub pa'i mchog tu phra ba de la rdul phra rab ces bdag cag rnams zer ro //
translated: When it is reduced to the smallest size possible, we call it an atom.

original: de yang cha shas dang bcas pa nyid yin na cha shas de'i yang cha shas rnams dang de'i cha shas kyi yang cha shas rnams zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa 'di yang thug pa med pas mtha' ma mtha' med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yang cha shas dang bcas pa nyid yin na cha shas de'i yang cha shas rnams dang de'i cha shas kyi yang cha shas rnams zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa 'di yang thug pa med pas mtha' ma mtha' med pa'i phyir //
translated: If it has parts, then the parts of those parts and the parts of those parts would be infinite, and there would be no end.

original: rdzas rnams thams cad kyi tshad dang lci ba nyid dag gi grangs dang 'bras bu dang rgyu dag gi mtshungs pa'i tshad nyid la sogs par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rdzas rnams thams cad kyi tshad dang lci ba nyid dag gi grangs dang 'bras bu dang rgyu dag gi mtshungs pa'i tshad nyid la sogs par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: The size and weight of all substances, the number of effects and causes, and so on would be impossible.

original: de ltar yang bgrang du med pa'i phyir phra ba'i phra ba nyid kyang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang bgrang du med pa'i phyir phra ba'i phra ba nyid kyang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it would be impossible to count them, the smallest of the small would also be eliminated.

original: 'on te dbye byed ni mtha' med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dbye byed ni mtha' med pa ma yin te /
translated: But the divisions are not infinite.

original: de lta mod kyi zad pa'i mtha'i bar du yin no snyam na yang /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi zad pa'i mtha'i bar du yin no snyam na yang /
translated: But if you think that it is until the end of exhaustion,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: dbye bya zad na dbye byed mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbye bya zad na dbye byed mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the object of division is exhausted, the division is not tenable.

original: dbye ba ni zhig pa yin pa la dbye bya med na ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: dbye ba ni zhig pa yin pa la dbye bya med na ni mi rigs so //
translated: If the object of division does not exist, it is unreasonable for the division to be destroyed.

original: de'i phyir re zhig sa phyogs rgya chen po la nye bar dmigs par snang ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig sa phyogs rgya chen po la nye bar dmigs par snang ba ni /
translated: Therefore, first, the appearance of the extensive place being observed

original: cha shas dang bcas pa kho na yin pas sa phyogs dang bcas pa'i don dang phrad pa yin te /
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa kho na yin pas sa phyogs dang bcas pa'i don dang phrad pa yin te /
translated: is only with parts, so it is in contact with the object that has a place.

original: don dang rdzas su phrad pa yin gyi de rgya che ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dang rdzas su phrad pa yin gyi de rgya che ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is in contact with the object and substance, but it is not extensive.

original: gzhung lugs des chog ste tshad ma la 'jug pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhung lugs des chog ste tshad ma la 'jug pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: That is sufficient for the system, so one should follow the Avatara.

original: yul nges pa la dngos por mthong bar byed na tshad ma ni 'jig rten 'jug par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul nges pa la dngos por mthong bar byed na tshad ma ni 'jig rten 'jug par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If the object is ascertained and seen as a thing, then the valid cognition engages with the world,

original: phrad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phrad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not in contact.

original: de'i phrad pa ni de la nye ba las de yang nye ba yin pa de lta min pa de nyid kyis na rgya che ba de ni du ba bzhin du yin gyi cha shas dang bcas pa'i snang ba ma gtogs pa cha shas dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phrad pa ni de la nye ba las de yang nye ba yin pa de lta min pa de nyid kyis na rgya che ba de ni du ba bzhin du yin gyi cha shas dang bcas pa'i snang ba ma gtogs pa cha shas dang bcas pa'am /
translated: Its contact is its proximity. It is not that, because it is extensive like smoke, but not like the appearance with parts, except for the parts.

original: cig shos nye bar dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos nye bar dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The other is not observed as proximate.

original: don gyi go bas kyang dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi go bas kyang dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not observed by the understanding of the meaning,

original: gzhan du yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists elsewhere.

original: de ltar na bum pa byed pa'i rgyu dang bcas pa las kham phor dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bum pa byed pa'i rgyu dang bcas pa las kham phor dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the pot is observed from the lump of clay together with the cause of its production.

original: bum pa ni 'jig pa'i dngos po'i chos nyid kyis 'jig pa yin te /ğŸ”½kham phor yang de dang bcas pa las de las gzhan bskyed nas 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: bum pa ni 'jig pa'i dngos po'i chos nyid kyis 'jig pa yin te / kham phor yang de dang bcas pa las de las gzhan bskyed nas 'jig pa yin la /
translated: The pot is destroyed by the nature of the thing to be destroyed.ğŸ”½The lump of clay is also produced from that together with it, and is destroyed by producing something else from it.

original: de yang de las gzhan par tha ma'i snang ba rnam par 'byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa med pa'i phyir 'dra ba'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang de las gzhan par tha ma'i snang ba rnam par 'byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa med pa'i phyir 'dra ba'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: And that is produced as a similar effect by the absence of the cooperating cause that distinguishes the final appearance.

original: rig pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa gzhan dang phrad pa las 'bras bu @149b gzhan rtsom par mi byed par rang nyid dngos po'i chos nyid kyis gzhig pa yin gyi cha shas su phye ba nyid zhig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa gzhan dang phrad pa las 'bras bu @149b gzhan rtsom par mi byed par rang nyid dngos po'i chos nyid kyis gzhig pa yin gyi cha shas su phye ba nyid zhig pa ma yin te /
translated: It is destroyed by its own intrinsic reality, not by being destroyed through being divided into parts,

original: sgra dang blo la sogs pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang blo la sogs pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not seen in sound, the mind, and so on.

original: rigs pa 'di rdzas nyid la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa 'di rdzas nyid la ni ma yin te /
translated: This reasoning does not apply to substances.

original: shing la me dang phrad pa las zhig pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing la me dang phrad pa las zhig pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not seen that a log and so on is destroyed when it comes into contact with fire.

original: gang gi phyir me ni phru ba la sogs pa dum bur byed pa ma yin pa ni gzhung lugs yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir me ni phru ba la sogs pa dum bur byed pa ma yin pa ni gzhung lugs yin la /
translated: The position is that fire does not cause a pot and so on to be destroyed in fragments.

original: de'i phyir thug pa med pa'am de nyid phra mor byas pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir thug pa med pa'am de nyid phra mor byas pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is not the case that it is destroyed by being divided into subtle particles, nor is it the case that it is destroyed by being divided into parts.

original: thams cad zhig pa yin na ji ltar phrad pa yin /
analyzed: thams cad zhig pa yin na ji ltar phrad pa yin /
translated: If everything is destroyed, how could it come into contact with fire?

original: rdul phra rab rnams yod pa yin na de rnams mthong ba zhes pa de yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams yod pa yin na de rnams mthong ba zhes pa de yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If subtle particles exist, they would be seen.

original: dngos po'i bskyed pa ni rgyu med na med pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i bskyed pa ni rgyu med na med pa yin no //
translated: The production of an entity is not possible without a cause.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, because

original: thams cad 'jig par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / 'ga' yang de lta reg pa dang ldan pas reg par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½gang zhig bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhig pa de las 'bras bu bu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'jig par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / 'ga' yang de lta reg pa dang ldan pas reg par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhig pa de las 'bras bu bu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: we do not accept that everything is destroyed, and we do not accept that anything is in contact with that which is in contact with it.ğŸ”½If something is destroyed in all its aspects, an effect cannot arise from it.

original: shin tu'o // de dang 'dra ba yod pa las de dang 'dra ba skye ba la ni thams cad du skyon med do //
analyzed: shin tu'o // de dang 'dra ba yod pa las de dang 'dra ba skye ba la ni thams cad du skyon med do //
translated: If an effect arises from something similar to it, there is no problem.

original: de ltar na de nyid snang ba'i ngo bo ni rdul phra rab yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de nyid snang ba'i ngo bo ni rdul phra rab yin te /
translated: Thus, the nature of light is the atom,

original: snang ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes khas len na /
analyzed: snang ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes khas len na /
translated: because there is no other light.

original: de dbyibs dang ldan pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa nyid ni //
analyzed: de dbyibs dang ldan pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa nyid ni //
translated: If you think that the atom has shape,

original: 'on te mthong ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is seen.

original: snang ba'i ngo bo ni rdul phra rab ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: snang ba'i ngo bo ni rdul phra rab ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isnâ€™t the nature of light not the atom?

original: gzhan yang tshad ma med pa can yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshad ma med pa can yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Moreover, it is not a valid form of cognition.

original: rgyu med pas cha shas can ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pas cha shas can ma yin no //
translated: Since it is causeless, it is not a part-possessor.

original: gal te snang ba nyid kyi ngo bo rdul phra rab yin la /
analyzed: gal te snang ba nyid kyi ngo bo rdul phra rab yin la /
translated: If the nature of appearance is a subtle particle,

original: de'i tshe yang de rnams nyid mang por snang ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang de rnams nyid mang por snang ba yin la /
translated: then many of those appear.ğŸ”½Therefore, it is not a part-possessor.

original: de'i phyir cha shas can du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes snang ba dang mi snang ba'i rdul phra rab sgrub pa dang / dgag pa 'bras bu yin par nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir cha shas can du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes snang ba dang mi snang ba'i rdul phra rab sgrub pa dang / dgag pa 'bras bu yin par nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: The conclusion that the establishment and refutation of the subtle particles of appearance and nonappearance are the effects is

original: gal te rdul phran grub min na //
analyzed: gal te rdul phran grub min na //
translated: If the subtle particle is not established,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the gross is not established.

original: cha shas med pa'i rdul phra rab dang / rags pa ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i rdul phra rab dang / rags pa ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the subtle particle without parts and the gross are contradictory effects is

original: phyogs gcig gis ni reg na de zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis ni reg na de zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it touches in one part, it is not a particle.

original: rdul phra rab rnams phrad pa med na 'bras bu rtsom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams phrad pa med na 'bras bu rtsom pa ma yin te /
translated: If the subtle particles do not touch, they do not begin the effect.

original: phrad pa dang cig shos dag la dbye ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrad pa dang cig shos dag la dbye ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that there would be no difference between touching and not touching.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi phrad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi phrad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that they touch with their entire selves.

original: cha shas med pa'i rdul phra rab rnams ni @150a * //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i rdul phra rab rnams ni @150a * //
translated: Partless subtle atoms are not reasonable because they are indivisible, and like milk in water, it is not reasonable for one subtle atom to enter another subtle atom.

original: dbyer med pa nyid kyis rdul phra rab gzhan la chu la 'o ma bzhin du rjes su 'jug par mi rigs pa'i phyir la phyogs gcig gis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyer med pa nyid kyis rdul phra rab gzhan la chu la 'o ma bzhin du rjes su 'jug par mi rigs pa'i phyir la phyogs gcig gis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by one part, because they are partless.

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: phyogs ni gcig nyid kyis zhes bya bas ni de bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya bar nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs ni gcig nyid kyis zhes bya bas ni de bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya bar nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: By saying â€œby one part,â€ it is indicated that it is by all of its own nature.

original: 'on te phyogs gcig gis ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig gis ma yin la /
translated: But if it is not by one part,

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: then it is not by all of its own nature,

original: cha shas med pa nyid la cha shas su rtogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cha shas med pa nyid la cha shas su rtogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is impossible to conceive of a part in what is partless.

original: rags pa 'ba' zhig bskyed par mthong ba las /
analyzed: rags pa 'ba' zhig bskyed par mthong ba las /
translated: Since it is seen that only the coarse is produced,

original: mtha'i rgyu rnams kyi phrad pa tsam yod par go ba yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: mtha'i rgyu rnams kyi phrad pa tsam yod par go ba yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: it is understood that the mere contact of the final causes exists.

original: thams cad phyogs kyi gcig nyid kyis //
analyzed: thams cad phyogs kyi gcig nyid kyis //
translated: All by one part of the direction

original: zhes bya ba 'di la yang bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya bar nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la yang bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya bar nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: Also, in this context, â€œby its entire natureâ€ is supplied.

original: gang gi phyir phrad pa yong na 'bras bu skye bar mthong ba'i phyir de rtogs bzhin pa ni ji ltar snang ba'i mthong ba'i bye brag yin gyi /ğŸ”½gzhan yin la bye brag med pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phrad pa yong na 'bras bu skye bar mthong ba'i phyir de rtogs bzhin pa ni ji ltar snang ba'i mthong ba'i bye brag yin gyi / gzhan yin la bye brag med pa'am /
translated: Because when contact exists, the effect is seen to arise, that which is being cognized is a specific instance of seeing that appears in that way.ğŸ”½It is not something else, nor is it a universal that is a specific instance of something not seen.

original: ma mthong ba'i bye brag can gyi spyi ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i bye brag can gyi spyi ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of â€œis not the object of inferenceâ€ is as follows:

original: rdul phra rab ma yin la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ma yin la /
translated: It is not a subtle particle.

original: khyad par gyi rigs gzhan yang ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rigs gzhan yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it a different type of particular.

original: phrad pa'i lhan cig pa'i rdul phra rab rnams 'bras bu rtsom par byed pa ma yin nam /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /ğŸ”½'byar ba dang cig shos kyi dbye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: phrad pa'i lhan cig pa'i rdul phra rab rnams 'bras bu rtsom par byed pa ma yin nam / 'di lta ste / 'byar ba dang cig shos kyi dbye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Donâ€™t subtle particles that contact each other produce the effect?ğŸ”½In that case, they would not be distinguished as conjoined or not conjoined.

original: de'i tshe de rnams gcig la gcig 'byar ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnams gcig la gcig 'byar ba yang ma yin te /
translated: At that time, they would not be conjoined with each other.

original: 'byar ba yang phrad pa yin na 'bras bu la phrad pa gzhan ltos pa yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa yin pas 'bras bu gzhan du mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pas /
analyzed: 'byar ba yang phrad pa yin na 'bras bu la phrad pa gzhan ltos pa yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa yin pas 'bras bu gzhan du mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pas /
translated: If contact is also conjunction, then since the effect would depend on another contact, there would be an infinite regress. Thus, the effect would not be different.

original: 'on te yang rdul phra rab gnyis kyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te yang rdul phra rab gnyis kyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if two atoms are not in contact, then how can they generate an effect?

original: lan ni gal te ma reg par yang ni zhes bya ba ste /ğŸ”½rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun reg pa ni phrad pa yin pa de lta na thug pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lan ni gal te ma reg par yang ni zhes bya ba ste / rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun reg pa ni phrad pa yin pa de lta na thug pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The response: If they are not in contact, then they would not be in contact with each other.ğŸ”½The intrinsic nature of atoms is to be in contact with each other, so there is no infinite regress.

original: tha dad par yin no de kho na de ste kun tu reg pa'i bdag nyid yin gyi rdul phra rab ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par yin no de kho na de ste kun tu reg pa'i bdag nyid yin gyi rdul phra rab ma yin no //
translated: They are different, but they are in contact in the sense that they are the same in being a collection.

original: de lta yin na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta yin na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: ji ltar gong bu'i rnam pa gcig / ces bya ba ste /ğŸ”½'byar ba'i bdag nyid kyi phrad pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar gong bu'i rnam pa gcig / ces bya ba ste / 'byar ba'i bdag nyid kyi phrad pa yin na /
translated: If they are not in contact, then how can they generate an effect?

original: de'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i rdul phra rab ba rnams la de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i rdul phra rab ba rnams la de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they are in contact in the sense of being joined, then atoms would not be in contact with each other, since they lack the nature of being joined.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the nature of one thing does not transform into another.

original: @150b 'on te cha shas can rnams phrad pa'i 'byar ba'i bdag nyid kyi rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa shes pa de'i yul yin gyi rdul phra rab ni yul ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: @150b 'on te cha shas can rnams phrad pa'i 'byar ba'i bdag nyid kyi rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa shes pa de'i yul yin gyi rdul phra rab ni yul ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: But if you think that the object of the cognition of the aggregation of subtle particles that are in contact with each other through conjunction is the possessor of parts, not the subtle particles,ğŸ”½then the treatise states:

original: 'on te yan lag can gzhan der zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag can gzhan der zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But if the possessor of parts is different from them,

original: rdul phra rab rnams la gcig tu shes pa ni rdul phra rab tu gnas pa'i dngos po'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la gcig tu shes pa ni rdul phra rab tu gnas pa'i dngos po'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the cognition of the subtle particles as one would not be the object of the thing that is composed of subtle particles.

original: gzhan du grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would be established as different.

original: de lta yin na de yod pa'i dus su rdul phra rab rnams kyang ma zhig pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin na de yod pa'i dus su rdul phra rab rnams kyang ma zhig pa yin la /
translated: If that were the case, then at the time when the possessor of parts exists, the subtle particles would not disintegrate.ğŸ”½But why would they not appear even though they are suitable to be objects?

original: yul du rung ba yin yang cis mi snang ba yin zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yul du rung ba yin yang cis mi snang ba yin zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The treatise states:

original: rtogs pa'i phyir na mthong bar 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i phyir na mthong bar 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the realization, they are seen.

original: gal te yang rung ba'i yin yang de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bor ni rung ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gal te yang rung ba'i yin yang de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bor ni rung ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: But if you think that although they are suitable, they are not suitable as the intrinsic reality of those,ğŸ”½then NÄgÄrjuna explains:

original: gal te 'u cag la sogs kyis //ğŸ”½zhes bya smos te /
analyzed: gal te 'u cag la sogs kyis // zhes bya smos te /
translated: If we and so on.

original: dbang phyug la ltos nas sna tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang phyug la ltos nas sna tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are various in dependence on ÄªÅ›vara.

original: 'du ba can dag gi dang 'du ba so sor mthong ba yin na /
analyzed: 'du ba can dag gi dang 'du ba so sor mthong ba yin na /
translated: If the collection and the individual members of the collection are seen,

original: tha mi dad par grub pa dag gi 'brel pa ni 'du ba yin par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad par grub pa dag gi 'brel pa ni 'du ba yin par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: then NÄgÄrjuna explains that the relation of those that are established as not different would not be a collection:

original: mthong na 'du ba ji ltar yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mthong na 'du ba ji ltar yin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If seen, how could there be a collection?

original: gang gi phyir tha mi dad par grub pa rten dang brten pa nyid ni /ğŸ”½snal ma dang snam bu dag gi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha mi dad par grub pa rten dang brten pa nyid ni / snal ma dang snam bu dag gi /
translated: Because the relation of support and supported of those that are established as not differentğŸ”½is impossible, like the relation of warp and woof

original: snal ma'i cha dang / snal ma dag la brten pa'i phyir mi srid do//
analyzed: snal ma'i cha dang / snal ma dag la brten pa'i phyir mi srid do//
translated: in cloth and yarn, because they are not different.

original: tha dad par rtogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni de la rung pa'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: tha dad par rtogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni de la rung pa'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: The very possession of the realization of difference is the suitable intrinsic reality of that.

original: de yang ji ltar snang bas tha dad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar snang bas tha dad pa kho na yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is just as it appears, that is, it is different.

original: dbang phyug la ltos nas thams cad de ltar yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang phyug la ltos nas thams cad de ltar yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because everything is like that in relation to God.

original: tha mi dad par grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha mi dad par grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not established that they are not different.

original: gzugs dang sgra dag gi don gcig la 'du ba can dang / sna lam dang snam bu dag gi 'du ba yang 'u bu cag la sogs pa rnams kyis tha dad par ma mthong ba yang tha mi dad par grub pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dag gi don gcig la 'du ba can dang / sna lam dang snam bu dag gi 'du ba yang 'u bu cag la sogs pa rnams kyis tha dad par ma mthong ba yang tha mi dad par grub pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Also, the collection of form and sound, and the collection of cloth and thread, are not seen to be different by us and so on, but it is not established that they are not different.ğŸ”½In response to that, he says:

original: gzhan du ni /
analyzed: gzhan du ni /
translated: Otherwise,

original: mthong ba 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the seeing would be mistaken.

original: 'u bu cag la sogs pa ni snal ma dang snam bu dag du ma yang tha dad par snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'u bu cag la sogs pa ni snal ma dang snam bu dag du ma yang tha dad par snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The meaning is that we and so on do not see the many threads and cloth as different.

original: snal ma rnams ni snam bu ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: snal ma rnams ni snam bu ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the threads not cloth?

original: gcig dang du ma so sor snang ba'i bdag gi yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma so sor snang ba'i bdag gi yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the objects of the individual appearances of one and many are different.

original: gcig tu snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu snang ba ma yin te /
translated: They do not appear as one.

original: gzhan du na de'i sgra ni brda'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½de bzhin du dbang @151a * //ğŸ”½phyug gis tha dad par mthong la /
analyzed: gzhan du na de'i sgra ni brda'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir / de bzhin du dbang @151a * // phyug gis tha dad par mthong la /
translated: Otherwise, the term that would be a conceptual cognition that follows a sign.ğŸ”½Similarly, it is undermined by the fact that ÄªÅ›vara sees them as different,

original: 'u bu cag la sogs pa thams cad kyis tha mi dad par mthong bas gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'u bu cag la sogs pa thams cad kyis tha mi dad par mthong bas gnod pa yin te /
translated: but we and so on see them as undifferentiated.

original: 'du ba med pa yang de dang 'dra ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'du ba med pa yang de dang 'dra ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the same applies to the absence of contact.

original: gal te snang ba'i mtha' ma ni de las gzhan pa dang cha gcig gis phrad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba'i mtha' ma ni de las gzhan pa dang cha gcig gis phrad pa yin na /
translated: If the end of the appearance is contacted by something different from it through one part,

original: de'i cha gcig kyang de bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i cha gcig kyang de bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then because that one part is also like that,

original: mthar thug pa med pas phra mo dpag tu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthar thug pa med pas phra mo dpag tu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: there would be an infinite regress, and the subtle particle would become immeasurable.

original: de dang skyon mtshungs so snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de dang skyon mtshungs so snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Thinking that the same fault would apply to that, he says,

original: rags pa cha shas nyid du sngon du 'gro ba can /ğŸ”½zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rags pa cha shas nyid du sngon du 'gro ba can /ğŸ”½zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The coarse is preceded by parts.

original: gang la cha shas phrad pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du mthong ba de la de ltar 'gyur du zin kyang dper na 'ji ba'i gong bu sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bum pa dang / snal ma sngon du 'gro ba can snam bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang la cha shas phrad pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du mthong ba de la de ltar 'gyur du zin kyang dper na 'ji ba'i gong bu sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bum pa dang / snal ma sngon du 'gro ba can snam bu lta bu'o //
translated: If it were seen that the whole preceded the contact of its parts, then that would be the case, just as the pot precedes the lump of clay, and the cloth precedes the threads.

original: snang ba'i mtha' ma ni de lta bu nyid du mthong ba ma yin pa'i phyir cha shas sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du ci las shes /
analyzed: snang ba'i mtha' ma ni de lta bu nyid du mthong ba ma yin pa'i phyir cha shas sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du ci las shes /
translated: But the end of the appearance is not seen in that way, so how can it be known that the whole precedes the parts?

original: gang gis dpag tu med par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis dpag tu med par 'gyur //
translated: How could it be immeasurable?

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: cha shas dang phrad pa med kyang cha shas dang bcas par mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½wa ta'i sa bon shin tu chung //
analyzed: cha shas dang phrad pa med kyang cha shas dang bcas par mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni / wa ta'i sa bon shin tu chung //
translated: To show that it is seen to have parts even though it does not contact them, he says:

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The seed of the vata plant is very small.

original: gang gi tshe snga na yod pa'i yan lag rnams ni ma dmigs pa'i yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snga na yod pa'i yan lag rnams ni ma dmigs pa'i yod pa ma yin la /
translated: When the prior parts are not seen to exist,

original: de'i tshe de rnams phrad pa'i sgo nas yan lag can rtsom par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnams phrad pa'i sgo nas yan lag can rtsom par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: then it is shown that the whole does not arise through the contact of those parts.

original: yan lag can yang ga la yin //ğŸ”½zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag can yang ga la yin // zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: how much less could it be a whole?ğŸ”½The example of the sprout of the vata tree is not appropriate.

original: shing wa ta'i myu gu yang snang ba'i tha ma bzhin du yan lag sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyi phyogs kho na ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni 'on te nam mkha'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shing wa ta'i myu gu yang snang ba'i tha ma bzhin du yan lag sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyi phyogs kho na ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni 'on te nam mkha'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that the sprout of the vata tree is not the only case of a whole that has parts that precede it, then you should consider the example of space.

original: de lta yin na shing wa ta rnams kyi nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na shing wa ta rnams kyi nus pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the capacity of the vata tree is not the cause of the sprout,

original: ma mthong ba'i bye brag gis lhan cig byed pa'i rdul phra rab rnams nyid myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i bye brag gis lhan cig byed pa'i rdul phra rab rnams nyid myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro /
translated: because the atoms that are the co-operating causes of the sprout are not seen.

original: zhes lan du bstan pa ni gnas pa la sogs par byed dam ci zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes lan du bstan pa ni gnas pa la sogs par byed dam ci zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is, â€œWhat is it that causes it to endure?â€

original: myu gu ni shing wa ta la sogs pa'i sa bon la ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: myu gu ni shing wa ta la sogs pa'i sa bon la ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: The sprout depends on the seed of the vata tree, etc.

analyzed: ma mthong ba'i yan lag tshogs pas 'phen par byed pa ma yin te /

original: thal ches par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thal ches par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: ji ltar yan lag dang bcas pa'i snam bu ni yan lag tshogs pa yin na 'gyur ba de bzhin du snang ba'i @151b tha ma'am /ğŸ”½shing wa ta'i myu gu zhes rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag dang bcas pa'i snam bu ni yan lag tshogs pa yin na 'gyur ba de bzhin du snang ba'i @151b tha ma'am / shing wa ta'i myu gu zhes rtogs pa yin na /

analyzed: yan lag bzhin du yan lag can yod pa kho nar 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa kho nas zer ba ni /

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'di mthong ba yod pa nyid kho na gang mi gsal ba ni mar me la sogs pa rnams kyis gsal bar byed pa yin pa ni sgron ma'i dpe'i stobs kyis na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di mthong ba yod pa nyid kho na gang mi gsal ba ni mar me la sogs pa rnams kyis gsal bar byed pa yin pa ni sgron ma'i dpe'i stobs kyis na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The existence of the mere seeing is made clear by the power of the lamp example, since the unclear is made clear by lamps and so on.

analyzed: mar me gsal bar byed pa nyid kho na dbang phyug med na gsal bar byed par mi 'gyur ram snyam du sems pa la /

analyzed: de yang sems pas byin brlabs na //

original: zhes bya ba ste ci'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste ci'i phyir /

analyzed: gzhan de mi mi byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: thams cad kyang yod bzhin pa nyid kyis bya ba med pa'i phyir /

analyzed: sems pa can gzhan yang rung byed pa po ma yin par bstan pa ni /

original: de'i phyir snang ba'i tha ma 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba'i tha ma 'am /

analyzed: myu gu ni ji lta bu'i mi rtag pa las sam /

original: sems pa can ma yin pa las skye ba yin la /
analyzed: sems pa can ma yin pa las skye ba yin la /

original: de nyid de la nus pa yin gyi rdul phra rab rnams kyi 'am /
analyzed: de nyid de la nus pa yin gyi rdul phra rab rnams kyi 'am /
translated: That is the potential for that, but not for the atoms or

analyzed: dbang phyug gi ni ma yin pa'i phyir de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan nyid ni rgyu mtshan med pa dang 'gal ba yin par nye bar bsdu ba ni / des na gang gang gang gang las //
translated: ÄªÅ›vara. The summary that the mere reason is unreasonable and contradictory:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever arises from whatever

original: dbang phyug la yang ma mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la yang ma mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o //
translated: Some say that even with respect to ÄªÅ›vara, there is non-observation.

original: 'on te / de las tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te / de las tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: If it is not a valid cognition with respect to that,

original: dbang phyug la yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la yang mi 'gyur ro //

original: zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni /

translated: If you say it is not because it is contradicted by perception,

analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: pha rol po'i 'khrul pas sgro 'dogs pa dgag pa yin gyi /

analyzed: khyad par ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa rnams su bsgrag par bya ba ma yin no //

analyzed: sa gzhi la sogs pa sems pa can ma yin pa'i nye bar len pa nyid dam /

analyzed: cig shos ni des pa can yin gyi nges par byed pa tsam du go bar byed pa yin gyi sems pa can ni ma yin no //

original: zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes bstan zin to //

original: de ltar ci las shes she na /
analyzed: de ltar ci las shes she na /

analyzed: dbyibs sogs ci 'dra byin rlob po //

original: yod med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yod med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: â€œ Existence and non-existenceâ€ are mentioned.

analyzed: gang gi phyir nges pa ni yod pa dang med pa dag gis nges par byed pa tsam gyi rjes su sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /

analyzed: sems pa can ni ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phul du byung ba dang / cig shos dag gi phul du byung ba dang // cig shos dag med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: @152a * // de yang ci 'dra ba las ji lta bur gang dmigs pa de 'dra ba nyid rjes su dpog par byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is taught that one infers the very same thing that is observed from the very same thing.

analyzed: yang na nges pa can tsam ni nges par byed pa tsam du go bar byed pa yin par 'dod pa grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to //

original: nges pa can gyi bye brag gis sems pa can la sogs pa nges pa'i bye brag ni nges pa'i bye brag mthong ba yin na go bar byed pa yin gyi /

original: nges pa can tsam ma yin zhing nges pa'i bye brag ma rtogs pa la yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa can tsam ma yin zhing nges pa'i bye brag ma rtogs pa la yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /

original: ci 'dra ba las ji lta bur gang dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba las ji lta bur gang dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes dpe dang bcas pa'i ldog pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The negation along with an example is taught:

original: tha dad dngos por rab sgrub pa //
analyzed: tha dad dngos por rab sgrub pa //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: ldog pa'i nges pa can bstan pa nyid kyi shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba bstan par go ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de lta yin na rig byed dang aa ti ha sa'i gtsug lag la sogs pa dang / khron pa rnying pa dang lha rten la sogs pa rnams kyis yang byed pa po dran bzhin pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na rig byed dang aa ti ha sa'i gtsug lag la sogs pa dang / khron pa rnying pa dang lha rten la sogs pa rnams kyis yang byed pa po dran bzhin pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: If that is so, then the Vedas, the sacred texts of the Ä€á¹­há¹›gvas, and so on, and old wells, temples, and so on, are the memory of the maker.

analyzed: blo phul du byung ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa yin gyi sems pa can tsam la ni mi srid pa ni de'i bye brag ste /
translated: The specific feature of that is the activity of a mind of superior quality and so on, but it is impossible for it to be the activity of a mere conscious being.

original: dbang phyug nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag rjes su dpog pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang phyug nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag rjes su dpog pa yin la /

original: de lta bu'i shes pa phul du byung bas dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes pa phul du byung bas dgos pa yin te /
translated: The purpose of such a superior consciousness is

analyzed: bsnyen bkur gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir te gzhan gyis ci dgos /
translated: that it is the object of veneration, for what else is needed?

original: 'u cag la sogs pa'i sems pa can tsam las ni /
analyzed: 'u cag la sogs pa'i sems pa can tsam las ni /

original: de lta bu'i 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: such an entity does not arise.

original: dbang po la 'das pa dang mi las 'phags pa las de'i don rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de kho na tshad ma yin no zhe na /ğŸ”½yod med rjes 'jug can grub pa //
analyzed: dbang po la 'das pa dang mi las 'phags pa las de'i don rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de kho na tshad ma yin no zhe na / yod med rjes 'jug can grub pa //
translated: If you say that the valid cognition is just that, because it is the nature of the object of the sense faculties that is superior to humans,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then we reply:ğŸ”½The existence or nonexistence of the object is established by the conformity of the cognition.

original: snyan dang gas la sogs pa yang ma yin pa tsam las byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: snyan dang gas la sogs pa yang ma yin pa tsam las byung ba ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, the sense faculties are not the cause of mere nonexistence,

original: bum pa la sogs pa yang rung ste thams cad kyis de'i byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yang rung ste thams cad kyis de'i byed pa ma yin la /
translated: and a pot, etc., is not the cause of all cognitions.

original: de dag tsam gyis thams cad phul du byung ba'i sems pa can du sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag tsam gyis thams cad phul du byung ba'i sems pa can du sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that all are established as having excellent cognition by virtue of those alone.

original: de'i phyir goms pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i 'u bu cag la sogs pa 'ga' kho na rdza mkhan la sogs pa bzhin du rjes su dpog par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir goms pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i 'u bu cag la sogs pa 'ga' kho na rdza mkhan la sogs pa bzhin du rjes su dpog par byed pa yin gyi /

original: shin tu dbang po las 'das pa'i nus pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu dbang po las 'das pa'i nus pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that they possess the ability to perceive objects that are extremely beyond the sense faculties.

original: de lta bu'i phul du byung ba med na ji ltar dbang po las @152b 'das pa'i yul nye bar ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i phul du byung ba med na ji ltar dbang po las @152b 'das pa'i yul nye bar ston pa yin te /
translated: If there is no such excellence, how can they perceive objects that are extremely beyond the sense faculties?

original: de 'di ni bskyed bya'i dngos po 'bras bu la yang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'di ni bskyed bya'i dngos po 'bras bu la yang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: This is similar to the case of the effect that is to be generated.

original: de la brdzun pa yin gyi rig byed la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la brdzun pa yin gyi rig byed la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is false, but not the Vedas,

original: grub pa'i mtha' pa thams cad dang / rigs thams cad kyang tha snyad la mi slu bas tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /ğŸ”½'di yang par sig rnams dang thod pa can la sogs pa mang po rnams kyi rang rang gi lung rnams la tha snyad mi slu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' pa thams cad dang / rigs thams cad kyang tha snyad la mi slu bas tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro / 'di yang par sig rnams dang thod pa can la sogs pa mang po rnams kyi rang rang gi lung rnams la tha snyad mi slu ba'i phyir /
translated: because all philosophical schools and all reasonings are valid cognitions in that they are nondeceptive with regard to conventions.

original: mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: This is similar to the case of the many scriptures of the Parsis, the Ucchedavada, and so on, which are nondeceptive with regard to conventions.

original: don la mi slu ba ni gnyi ga la yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don la mi slu ba ni gnyi ga la yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are nondeceptive with regard to their object,ğŸ”½both are valid cognitions.

original: 'di dang mi 'dra ba'i byin gyis rlob pa po 'grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: 'di dang mi 'dra ba'i byin gyis rlob pa po 'grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that the one who is empowered is established in a way that is not similar to the other.

original: rig byed rtag pa nyid yin pas dag byed dang dag byed ma yin pa'i rdzas nyid kyis shes pa bzhin dang / me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa bzhin du dbang phyug gi rang gi ngo bo'i shes pa yin la /
analyzed: rig byed rtag pa nyid yin pas dag byed dang dag byed ma yin pa'i rdzas nyid kyis shes pa bzhin dang / me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa bzhin du dbang phyug gi rang gi ngo bo'i shes pa yin la /
translated: Because the Vedas are permanent, they are like the cognition of the substance of that which purifies and that which does not purify, and like the cognition that establishes fire sacrifice and so on.

analyzed: de yang byang grol sgrub par byed pa'i phyir /

original: skyes bu'i don grub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don grub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: they are the means of accomplishing the purpose of persons.

original: yod med rjes 'jug can grub pa //
analyzed: yod med rjes 'jug can grub pa //

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is stated.

original: gal te rig byed rnams rtag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed rnams rtag pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the Vedas are permanent,

analyzed: dbang phyug rtag pa nyid rig byed rtag pa nyid brjod byar 'gyur te /
translated: then the permanence of ÄªÅ›vara would be expressed as the subject matter of the Vedas.

original: 'on kyang byed pa po las ma byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang byed pa po las ma byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: However, because the Vedas are not produced by an agent,ğŸ”½the result of that contradiction is seen to follow after the mind.

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu blo'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sbyor ba'i bye phrag mthong bas rtag pa bkag pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu blo'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sbyor ba'i bye phrag mthong bas rtag pa bkag pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because permanence is refuted,ğŸ”½the fault of doubt does not exist.

original: dogs pa'i skyon des dbang phyug ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dogs pa'i skyon des dbang phyug ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that ÄªÅ›vara is not established.

original: yang na yul stong pa la sogs pa la byed pa po mi dran pa'i lha rten rnying pa la sogs pa mthong nas /
analyzed: yang na yul stong pa la sogs pa la byed pa po mi dran pa'i lha rten rnying pa la sogs pa mthong nas /
translated: Or else, seeing an old temple and so on, where no one is remembered as the creator of the empty space and so on,

analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i byed pa po mthong ba yin na /
translated: one sees a creator similar to that.

original: ji ltar mthong ba las byed pa po rjes su dpag par rigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba las byed pa po rjes su dpag par rigs pa yin gyi /

analyzed: sa gzhi la sogs pa'i dbyibs la sogs pa rnams la ni de lta bu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But such a thing does not exist in the shape and so on of the ground and so on.

analyzed: de lta bu ni blo las byung ba nyid kyis ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because such a thing is not seen due to arising from the mind.

original: yod med rjes 'jug can grub pa //
analyzed: yod med rjes 'jug can grub pa //
translated: The establishment of the one who follows existence and nonexistence

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is stated.

original: blo sngon du 'gro ba can gyis sngar mthong nas /
analyzed: blo sngon du 'gro ba can gyis sngar mthong nas /
translated: Having seen it before with the mind going first,

original: lha rten rnying pa la sogs pa dag la de nyid kyi rjes su byed pas /
analyzed: lha rten rnying pa la sogs pa dag la de nyid kyi rjes su byed pas /
translated: in old temples and so on, by following that very thing,

analyzed: blo la rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin nam /

original: gzhan du ni ma yin la de 'di ni sa gzhi la sogs pa yang mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin la de 'di ni sa gzhi la sogs pa yang mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: But it is not otherwise, and this is the same for the ground and so on.

original: de la ni bskyed pas sam /
analyzed: de la ni bskyed pas sam /
translated: And there, by producing it,

original: sems pa can gyis nye bar len pa @153a * //
analyzed: sems pa can gyis nye bar len pa @153a * //

analyzed: nyid kyi rjes su mi byed pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: mngon sum gyi rtogs byar tha dad pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason is contradictory because it is different from the object of direct perception,

original: de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs so //ğŸ”½phyogs la khyab par byed pa mthun pa'i phyogs la yong la /ğŸ”½mi mthun pa'i phyogs las log pa khyab pa ma tshang ba'am /
analyzed: de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs so // phyogs la khyab par byed pa mthun pa'i phyogs la yong la / mi mthun pa'i phyogs las log pa khyab pa ma tshang ba'am /
translated: that is the same for others.ğŸ”½The pervasion is that the reason is present in similar instances and absent in dissimilar instances.ğŸ”½The reason is not unestablished.

original: sbyor byed nyid kyang ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor byed nyid kyang ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not contradictory.

original: gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa las yang de lta bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /ğŸ”½tha dad dngos la rab grub pa //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa las yang de lta bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la / tha dad dngos la rab grub pa //
translated: If you think that the reason is contradictory because it would follow that the reason would be the thesis,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said:ğŸ”½â€œThe entity is well established as different.â€

original: bum pa dang lha rten la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni phul du 'byung ba'i sems pa can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir nges khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: bum pa dang lha rten la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni phul du 'byung ba'i sems pa can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir nges khyab pa yin la /
translated: The nature of a vase, a temple, and so on is ascertained as pervaded by the mind that is its superior because it follows the mind that is its superior and it follows the reversal of that.

original: sems pa can ni de la khyab byed du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: sems pa can ni de la khyab byed du nges pa yin te /

original: du ba la me lta bu de nyid las 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: du ba la me lta bu de nyid las 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is established from that very thing, like fire from smoke.

analyzed: khyab pa can ma yin pas gzhi la sogs pa'i ngo bo las ni ma yin no //
translated: But not from the nature of the locus, etc., because it is not universal.

original: ldog pa tsam las khyab pa tsam du grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa tsam las khyab pa tsam du grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not established as mere pervasion from mere exclusion,

original: rtag pa nyid la mnyan par bya ba nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid la mnyan par bya ba nyid lta bu'o //

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i ngo bo ma yin te /

original: gang gi rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur /

original: bum pa dang lha rten la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni chos can gyi dbye ba ma rtogs pa'i tha snyad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa dang lha rten la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni chos can gyi dbye ba ma rtogs pa'i tha snyad pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of a pot, temple, etc. is not a conventional [entity] that does not understand the division of the subject,

original: du ba dang byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: du ba dang byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: like smoke and being produced.

original: skad cig ma'i dbye ba la yang rjes su dpag pa la dgos pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i dbye ba la yang rjes su dpag pa la dgos pa yod pa ma yin te /

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha dad kyang yul nges pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha dad kyang yul nges pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: nges pa can yang de dang gcig pa nyid yin la /

analyzed: de bzhin du sa gzhi la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni de la nges pa ma yin no //

original: de'i phyir nges sems pa can nyid du nges par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges sems pa can nyid du nges par 'gyur ba ma yin te /

original: mdog skya ba nyid me la nges pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdog skya ba nyid me la nges pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the nature of being pale is not ascertained in fire.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa dag la yod pa dang med pa tsam ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa dag la yod pa dang med pa tsam ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma yin te /
translated: Mere existence and non-existence in the similar and dissimilar classes are not pervasion and non-pervasion.

original: rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams ni nges par rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams ni nges par rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the words â€œpervasion,â€ etc. are used to express ascertainment.

original: khyab pa can las ni grub pa yin la /
analyzed: khyab pa can las ni grub pa yin la /
translated: It is established from a pervasion,

original: khyab pa can ma yin pa las ni mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyab pa can ma yin pa las ni mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but not from a non-pervasion. This is the meaning.

original: yang na ji ltar na sa gzhi la sogs pa'i ngo bo nges pa dang ldan pa ni nges par byed pa'i @153b las kyis 'phangs pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar na sa gzhi la sogs pa'i ngo bo nges pa dang ldan pa ni nges par byed pa'i @153b las kyis 'phangs pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Or else, just as the nature of the earth, etc. is ascertained as having a definite nature, it is projected by the action of ascertainment.

original: bum pa'i ngo bo bzhin du sems pa can yang ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa'i ngo bo bzhin du sems pa can yang ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is a sentient being not like the nature of a pot?ğŸ”½Because it is well established that different things

original: tha dad dngos la rab grub pa //ğŸ”½zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad dngos la rab grub pa // zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: are related to different things.

original: dngos su ba'i 'brel pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: dngos su ba'i 'brel pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: The word â€œonlyâ€ in the verse is to be supplied from the preceding line.

original: gang yang rung ba cung zad kyang go bar byed pa yin gyi skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½de nyid kyis ni gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba cung zad kyang go bar byed pa yin gyi skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no // de nyid kyis ni gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bas bstan pa yin te /
translated: The meaning is that a word is related to a particular thing, and it makes that thing understood, not by the power of human choice,ğŸ”½but because that is the way the word is.ğŸ”½The word â€œonlyâ€ in the verse shows that the word is related to that thing and not to anything else.

original: khyab par byed pa sgrub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan du sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa sgrub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan du sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the word is related to that thing and not to anything else.

original: mdog skya ba nyid ni me sgrub pa la ma nges pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mdog skya ba nyid ni me sgrub pa la ma nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isnâ€™t the property of being white, as a proof of fire, inconclusive?

analyzed: zla ba dang me tog kun da la sogs pa la de la de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists in the moon, jasmine flowers, and so on, even though fire does not.

original: de bzhin du sems pa can ma yin pa'i nye bar len pa'am bskyed pa ni blo dang ldan pa ma yin pa nam mkha' la sogs pa la yod pa ni ma yin no zhes brgal ba byed pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems pa can ma yin pa'i nye bar len pa'am bskyed pa ni blo dang ldan pa ma yin pa nam mkha' la sogs pa la yod pa ni ma yin no zhes brgal ba byed pa ni /
translated: Likewise, the non-mental appropriator or generator does not exist in the non-mental, such as space.

original: 'on te 'gyur na yang /
analyzed: 'on te 'gyur na yang /
translated: But even if it does,

original: gal te khyad par dang bral ba'i mdog skya ba nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te khyad par dang bral ba'i mdog skya ba nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is only the color of the smoke that is the sign, not the color of the fire.ğŸ”½The reply:ğŸ”½By mere non-harm

original: lan ni / gnod pa med pa tsam gyis ni //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni / gnod pa med pa tsam gyis ni // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is:ğŸ”½By mere non-harmfulness,ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: ji lta ba kho na ni mdog skya ba nyid ni me med kyang yod pas ma 'khrul bar me nges pa'i phyir sgrub byed ma yin la /ğŸ”½de bzhin du sa gzhi la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang blo dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: ji lta ba kho na ni mdog skya ba nyid ni me med kyang yod pas ma 'khrul bar me nges pa'i phyir sgrub byed ma yin la / de bzhin du sa gzhi la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang blo dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: The color of smoke exists even without fire, so the color of smoke alone is not a valid proof for ascertaining fire.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la 'brel pa can du dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la 'brel pa can du dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, the nature of the ground, etc. is not observed as related to the pot, etc. if it is intelligent.

original: gzhan mthong ba yin na de'i mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan mthong ba yin na de'i mthong ba ma yin te /

analyzed: dbang phyug ma yin pa byed pa po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: thal ches pa'i de nyid bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½de lta min la rdza mkhan gyis //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i de nyid bstan pa ni / de lta min la rdza mkhan gyis //
translated: The teaching of the absurdity of the opponent's position is as follows:

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But the pot is not seen to be produced by that which is not a potter.

original: 'ji ba'i 'gyur ba can gyi bum pa'i ngo bo ni rdza mkhan gyi bskyed byar dmigs nas /
analyzed: 'ji ba'i 'gyur ba can gyi bum pa'i ngo bo ni rdza mkhan gyi bskyed byar dmigs nas /
translated: The nature of a pot, which is a transformation of clay, is seen to be produced by a potter.

original: gzhan du de'i bya ba ji lta ba kho na ma mthong ba yang de dang 'dra bar mthong ba las go ba yin la /ğŸ”½de bzhin du grog mkhar la sogs pa la yang go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du de'i bya ba ji lta ba kho na ma mthong ba yang de dang 'dra bar mthong ba las go ba yin la / de bzhin du grog mkhar la sogs pa la yang go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, one understands that the activity of that which is not a potter is not seen in the production of a pot.ğŸ”½In the same way, one understands that the activity of a non-creator is not seen in the production of an anthill and so on.

analyzed: khyim gyi ra ba dang mkhar gyi ba gam la sogs pa des ma byas pa la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'di yang ma nges pa kho na yin no zhe na /

analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir /

original: ma nges pa can nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa can nyid kho na'o //

original: 'di yang @154a * //
analyzed: 'di yang @154a * //
translated: This is also

analyzed: phyogs su byed pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
